definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
companion/partner/group/classifier for groups of people/to combine/together

sentences.english: One member of the commission dissented from the rest on two important matters.
sentences.chinese: 委員會中的一名在兩件重大事情上與大夥產生異議。

sentences.english: The sky rains and lightnings, they are scared and run immediately.
sentences.chinese: 天空立即落起大雨，而且行雷閃電，大夥兒立即。

sentences.english: People would have laughed at me… a cellar rat selling real estate.
sentences.chinese: 大夥兒會笑話我的，一隻住地下室的耗子賣房地產。

sentences.english: I'll go and pick us some grapefruits .
I think mass frugality would be good for the economy.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲大夥都過節儉的生活纔對經濟有利。

sentences.english: Mazel tov to the bride and groom.
Based on the scheduling principle of Dahuofang reservoir, we set up an integrated flood regulation system in Hun basin.
sentences.chinese: 建立了以大夥房水庫爲中心的渾河流域防洪調度系統。

sentences.english: After some discussion, they all trooped out of the cave and started a march on Landlord Wang's home.
sentences.chinese: 經過一番討論後，大夥兒湧出窯洞，朝着王常盈家衝。

sentences.english: Please bring two to three great dishes to share.
sentences.chinese: 請每家帶兩三道拿手好菜，大夥共享佳淆。

sentences.english: Unbeknown to everybody, Rachel is apparently the pregnant one.
sentences.chinese: 大夥不知道的是，瑞秋纔是懷孕的人。

sentences.english: When we met in the street the houses had grown somber.
sentences.chinese: 大夥兒在街上碰頭時，四周的房子都已黯淡下來。

sentences.english: I definitely wouldn't wear my trousers low to work, but it's the way we all dress for social gatherings.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定不會穿成這樣去上班，但聚會時大夥都這麼穿。

sentences.english: Most of us know what pleasure Ernie got from your article.
sentences.chinese: 我們大夥知道，厄尼從你的文章中獲得無窮的快樂。

sentences.english: The veteran worker ranks high in public love and esteem.
sentences.chinese: 那位老工人深受大夥的愛戴。

sentences.english: We all pitched in to buy this gift .
sentences.chinese: 這是我們大夥湊錢給您買的禮物。

definition: to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
companion/partner/group/classifier for groups of people/to combine/together
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
to worry/to feel anxious/Taiwan pr. [zhao1 ji2]
neighbors/next-door neighbors/related work units/colleagues doing related work
to suffer a crushing defeat (idiom)/in a pitiful state/in a complete mess/to roll (with laughter)
